description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (Section 73) to vary condition 2 (approved drawings) of planning permission ref: 174537FUL dated 02/03/2018 for the 'Conversion of single dwelling house into three self-contained units (1x two bedroom flat, 1 x 1 bedroom flat and 1 studio); single storey rear/side extension; alteration of roof from hip to gable end and rear roof extension; part rear roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope; and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope)'. Amendment seeks to rearrange the volume of the approved roof extension by reducing the depth of the extension over the outrigger and increasing the volume to the main roof.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission 174537FUL dated 02/03/2018.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with the existing building and details indicated in the submitted application form and on the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing and document title number(s): 2038/PP/01, 2038/PP/02, 2038/PP/03, 2038/PP/04 Rev.H, 2038/PP/05 Rev. C, 2038/PP/06 Rev. C, 2038/PP/07 Rev. C, 2038/PP/08 Rev. C, 2038/PP/09 Rev. C and 2038/PP/10 Rev. C;
And as hereby amended by: 2038/PP/01, 2038/PP/02, 2038/PP/03, 2038/PP/04 Rev.F, 2038/PP/05 Rev. E, 2038/PP/06 Rev. F, 2038/PP/07 Rev. F, 2038/PP/08 Rev. F, 2038/PP/09 Rev. F and 2038/PP/10 Rev. F;

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The proposed refuse and recycling storage proposed as per approved drawing no.2038/PP/04 Rev. F; shall be fully implemented and made available for use and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Ealing Management DPD (2013) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016. | Secure and sheltered bicycle storage facilities shall be provided for four (4) cycle spaces as per approved plans drawing no.2038/PP/04 Rev. F and shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development, hereby permitted and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate provision of bicycle storage and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, all in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) and (g) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The proposed window in the side elevation facing no.5 Willcott Road shall contain only obscure glass (minimum level 3 obscure glazed) and non-opening unless the parts of the window can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the rooms in which the window are installed. The window shall be retained permanently.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 3.1 (b) and 3.8 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016. | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
- Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
- Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the unit and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan 2016; Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration | The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with details of the sound insulation measures submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application: 181086CND dated 27.03.2018 | Prior to occupation of the approved residential dwellings, certification shall be provided to the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that the party wall between 3 Willcott Road and 1 Willcott Road is designed and constructed meeting the requirements for airborne sound insulation in accordance with Approved Document E [Resistance to the passage of sound].

Reason:  In the interests of amenity for the neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
